attributes.content: Thank you very much for helping me out with gathering herbs, Ms. Utage, Ms. Beanstalk.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: There is no way I could've found nearly this many without the two of you...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Oh, it's no biggie. I don't go on field ops much. It's a great change of pace.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: And, geez. Just call me Utage. We're a buncha girls on a trip! Let's make this a fun little get-together!
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I mean, we're friends, aren't we? Don't be so stiff.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Oh, i-is that so?! Friends...? But I...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I... I don't know much about fashion, and I'm not very good at talking... Can I really be friends with you?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: What're you talking about? Of course you can! You're on my contact list, and I can call you any time and go shopping with you. That makes us friends!
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Look, your name is right here, Myrrh.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Whoa! Ms. Utage... I mean, Utage, you know a lot of people!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Huh? What's this list here?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Oh, 'Afternoon Nails Club?' Probably the list I added the most people to.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: What about this?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That's the 'Group Buy Coupon Club' list.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Um, how about this...?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: The 'Peeps That Don't Do Events But Pay Up' list! Haha, all of them are like my besties!
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: (If she adds me to this list... I might end up... crying...)
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: (She wouldn't do that, right?)
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Hey, that sounds like a great group. You gotta introduce me to some of those besties of yours!
Oh, Ms. Beanstalk! You're back!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Kept ya waiting, huh~?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I got caught up in the road up ahead. It's a little hard to get through.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: By the way, Utage, which list did you add Myrrh and me to? It can't be that besties club, right?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Oh, relax. You wouldn't make it in even if you wanted to.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: You're on the 'Gonna Treat Lunch Some Time' list. She's on 'Medical Department.'
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Huh? Hold on, what's this supposed to mean? I've treated you to lunch more than a handful of times!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Besides, why is Myrrh on such a normal-sounding list?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Ahaha... I don't really mind...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: She takes care of me when I'm sick or hurt. Gotta give respect where it's due.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: (Quietly) Besides, am I gonna get on a doctor's bad side? How stupid do you think I am?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Ugh, can we not talk about this, please? You went up ahead to scout the area, right? How is it? Any more herbs around?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I think we already got plenty, so if there aren't more up ahead, maybe we can call it a day here and go home?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Hmph, I'm getting there! I'll get to the end of this contact list thing...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Anyway, let me get straight to the point—I did find something.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I had Trey look all around, and he found a spot a little further north that we haven't been to yet.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Oh, you mean those little pets you got with you? Way to go.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Of course! Hehe, this is nothing more than a walk in the park for my little buddies!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: It's north of here... Going by the humidity, the amount of sunlight, and the terrain, it should be a perfect place for herbs to grow!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That sounds great! Let's head over there!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Hey, wait up! Let me finish!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Hm... Where's my map for this area...? Let's see... There we go! Take a look here.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I marked where we are in red, and that patch of grassland is over here.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Huh? This place...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Hm? Let's see.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Oh, are we really that far away from the ship? And what's this say over here...? Ibe... Ugh, it's way too small to read. Iberia?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Iberia, huh...?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I heard the nomadic cities there change color, and every place they cruise over turns to barren land where absolutely nothing can grow. Not sure if it's true, though.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Huh? No kidding?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: It could be that there are technical problems with their Originium energy source, and that might have polluted all the places they drove through.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: But absolutely nothing can grow there...? That sounds like a bit of an exaggeration.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Oh, that's hardly an exaggeration. There's more. I heard Iberia's cities can even change shape!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: The city plates can all fly away and put themselves back together again! They can even turn into giant, limbless monsters that swallow everything whole!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: T-They can turn into monsters?!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Um, that's not exactly how I heard it...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Why are we talking about this now? Shouldn't we figure out if we want to keep going?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Or what? Is it Iberia gossip time? Hm... Actually, why don't we do just that?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I mean, none of us dare say we know that much about Iberia, right? Let's talk about what we know, then. Maybe we'll figure out something helpful.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Well... I guess we can. We aren't in a rush anyway.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Well, I already told you what I know. Next up, Myrrh!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Huh? I need to say something too?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Of course~
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: O-Okay... I don't really think this is going to be very helpful, though...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Well, I heard that Iberia has a lot of ghost towns...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: (Quietly) Uhh—This doesn't sound all that different than what I said...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: (Quietly) Oh, hush, just let her talk.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I heard that people sometimes wander into these ghost towns when they get lost... It's cold and scary inside. There are blue rocks spread all over the roads, and there isn't a single person in any of the churches.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: But... if you take a closer look, even though the buildings are all empty, there are jewels built into everything, and the plaza has all these gold statues without even the tiniest blemish!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Jewels! Gold!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Eh, sounds kinda like the City of Gold. My dad used to always sing that song. When I was a kid, I really liked that story!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I wish that kinda town really existed. A road paved with jewels and gold! I really wanna see that with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Ahaha... I don't think I'd be so thrilled to visit that place...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I heard that in those ghost towns, each and every night, there are things you can't see praying at the church, and sometimes you can even hear someone breathing into your ear!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: On top of that, all the people who stray into those towns feel their bodies slowly turn harder and harder. They start to move slower, just like those old grandmoms and granddads. After that, they even start to talk slowly, and little by little, they lose their minds...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Whoa, that's sounds terrible.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: In the end, they can't move, they can't talk, and they can't think... They freeze up like the golden statues on the streets. Those statues were people!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: ...That's so scary!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Y-You're kidding, right? How is that even possible... That sounds even more out there than what I just said.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: It's gotta be fake. It's a good story, but think about it. How could anyone have spread the rumor in the first place if no one got out alive?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: You're right...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That's why I told you it wasn't going to be very helpful.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: This is a story I heard when I was still going around exploring with Harmonia... It's hardly reliable information.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Exploring?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Oh, actually... before I came to Rhodes Island, I used to be something of an explorer. I went to all kinds of places with my friends, and the more dangerous the place is, the rarer the herbs there are.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Eh, no kidding? That's amazing, Myrrh! I thought you were totally the kind of girl who, like, shut herself up in her room all day, brewing potions and whatever.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: You're kinda wimpy too.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: I'm not...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: So, it's my turn now, right?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I thought about it a little, and this rumor just came to mind...
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Ehh? We are still going with this?!
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: You seem really into it...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: It's just a story. What's the harm?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Well, you girls know how Iberia has this festival they call the carnival? Now, the carnival itself isn't the rumor; it actually exists, and I read about it in books before.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I heard it's one of those decked out festivals, and lots of tourists used to visit just for that, but there hasn't been a whole lot of news about the carnival anymore. Some people even say it was canceled.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: But... well... here's what I heard...
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: What have you heard? S-Stop it with that tone. It freaks me out...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Yeah, it's a little scary...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Alright, fine. I'll lay off.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: It's nothing that scary, really. I heard it wasn't actually canceled. It's just you don't get any normal people going to the carnival anymore.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Apparently, on the day of the carnival, bodies start climbing out of their graves, dancing all over the streets even though some of them are missing their arms and legs. During the carnival, all the people in town lock themselves in their houses. No one dares step outside.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: And what if they come outside?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: No idea about that. I heard a few different versions.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Some people say that you'll be eaten alive if you go outside. Others say you get cursed and line up behind everyone else, head into to the woods to the east, and end up hanging yourself.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Whatever it is, it's not a fun way to go out.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Okay, the end.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: So, wanna listen to more of these stories?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Eh, your face's all frozen. Are you... scared?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: O-Of course not! I don't get scared—
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Alright, you don't get scared. So, let's keep going!
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: (Utage looks like she's really enjoying this.)
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Um, aren't we getting a little off topic...?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: That's right!
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Let's not get too off track...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: These rumors all sound pretty farfetched. I don't think they're really that useful.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: It's just...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: It's pretty creepy, right? Is that what you were going to say?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: I mean, the rumors are probably so unrealistic because the whole area's on lockdown. If you think about it, it's pretty much what you'd expect.
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: So, are we still going north?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: We have plenty of the herbs we need already, don't we? Why don't we, uh...
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Why don't we just call it a day?
attributes.name: Beanstalk

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Hm? Myrrh, what's the matter? Why are you all spaced out?
attributes.name: Utage

attributes.content: Oh, it's nothing. I'm okay.
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: I'm just a little curious...
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Since there are so many scary rumors... What is Iberia actually like?
attributes.name: Myrrh

attributes.content: Stop right there, asshole! You're not getting away!
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: José, you shithead! Stop running away already!
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Ahhh!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: *Sobs*...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Why are you crying? You fell down on your own! I didn't even touch you!
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Stand up! This is all your fault... You were badmouthing me to the teachers at school, weren't you? You got me in trouble!
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: I didn't lie!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I saw it, Antonio! You were the one who stole the change Aunt Mirissa left on the table—
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: You still going on about that?! You little rata!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I... I'm not! I'm not a rata!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Oh, my dear children, don't do that.
Our tantrums, however brief, can lead to mistakes. Don't let your emotions get the better of you. Come, my child, stand up.
Who the hell are you?!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Uhh...!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: No way... Um, you..
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Um, thank you very much, sir... It's okay, I can stand up by myself.
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: There's mud all over me. I wouldn't want to get your hands dirty.
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: That is very considerate of you, my child. You have my thanks.
But you needn't worry. How is mud dirty? Everything we eat and wear is grown from the earth.
Here, take my hand. Stand up. That's right.
Um, sir, you're from the city, aren't you?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Do you know who I am?
There are rumors all over town that there's going to be an old gentleman visiting us from the city to give a... uh... what is it again...?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: A sermon! That's right! A sermon!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You're here to give a sermon, aren't you?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Yes, very perceptive, my child.
I've been asked to come here to share the gospel with all of you here...
You're a priest from the church?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Yes, my child. I am.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You'll teach us about the laws in the church's book and tell us stories about Laterano?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I will, my dear child, but that is not all I will be teaching you.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: The book teaches us that our noble laws are indestructible, and that we must believe it, follow it, and worship it. That is the righteous and correct thing to do... Correct, but perhaps a little off the mark.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I am merely human. In reality, I am no more holy than anyone else. That is why I also have many worthy stories of the people and things around us to share with you. I am here to close the distance between us and the law.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Father, what do you mean...? I'm not sure I understand.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Uh, Father, where are you headed? Is it the village headman's house? I'll take you there!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Thank you, my child.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: What I say is not important. What is truly important is what you've heard. You don't have to force yourself to understand.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Which way is it? Oh, watch out. Don't step on these flowers here. Give them the chance to grow.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: W-Wait...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Father!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Yes, my child?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I'm just wondering... Did you... see all that just now...?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: What did you see?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Did you catch everything... that I said?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: —I'm afraid I can't deny I did.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I heard everything loud and clear from the moment you fell.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Father, sir, I, I—
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Father, please! That's not how it is! I made it all up!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I made all of that up! Please!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: You think everything you said is nonsense, but is that really the case?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Antonio isn't a bad person. It's just, he...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: That's right! I-I lied! I was just seeing things... That's right! Antonio didn't steal anything, Father! I imagined all that! Please don't take him away!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: José!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: José, stop... stop it!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I-I know it's wrong to lie, but I'm jealous of Antonio. My grades are better than his, but I never get enough to eat. Soon, I won't even have enough money to go to school! I'm jealous of him!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I know those who steal get taken away. I know that. Hugo next door was taken away and never came back because he stole something from the stores in the city...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: That's why I ratted him out to the teachers! I was trying to frame him! It's all my fault!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I know what I did was wrong. Please, if you're here to take anyone away, take me! Please don't take him...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: 'We must not deceive others, for the deception deceives even ourselves.'
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: What are you talking about?! No one told you to say that!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: It's me, Father! You heard him! I stole that money...!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Antonio!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Stop it, José. Stop... Stop lying for me.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You aren't like that! When Old Man Pedro broke your leg last time, you didn't lie about that!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Ah, lies.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Lies can ruin us if we don't follow through with them. This is a most vile thing to do, yet... lies made with goodwill are what make us human.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Go on, my child.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: There isn't any more to say!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I stole Aunt Mirissa's money, but I'll pay her back! I found a job in town that pays really well!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: It's my fault for stealing. I'll go apologize. I ask for your forgiveness and just a little bit of time. I'll return the money when I have it.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: But why? Why did you do that?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: ...tuition...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Don't you want to keep going to school?! You're much better at studying than any of us! I know you're a little tight on money—
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Tsk, that didn't count! It's none of your business!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Anyway, that's how it is. I took the money because I wanted to. I said I'll pay it back. You caught me red-handed! I'll accept any punishment that comes my way!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Father, you're here to take me away, aren't you? Do it already!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Antonio...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Calm down, my child.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You think what you've done is wrong. In that case, would you like to confess your sins?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Y-Yeah! Let's confess!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: If you admit what you've done is wrong, you'll be forgiven, and you won't be punished...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Father, please. Please forgive him. Have mercy on Antonio! He'll be better!
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: The law says we mustn't steal or lie. I did both of those.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: But I don't regret it. I couldn't think of any other way. I don't regret doing this even if you're going to punish me.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Father, am I allowed to confess if I don't feel regret for my actions?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: That depends on what you think.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: All of us have our weaknesses, and who doesn't make mistakes?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: But when we make mistakes, are we forgiven simply because we repent our sins? Who has the right to forgive another, anyway?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I don't understand...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Isn't what I did wrong? I did something wrong, and I don't feel bad about it. That makes me a bad person...
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Does making a mistake once make you a bad person forever?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: If someone commits a crime with malice and then receives the proper punishment, does that really erase that malice and make her a sinner no longer?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Well... no...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Antonio stole money. He has sinned. As for you, José, you lied to me in order to protect him. You have sinned.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Do you think he's a bad person?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Lying goes against our teachings. Do you think you are a bad person?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I'm not... but I've done something wrong! Antonio did something wrong too, but if he doesn't repent his sins, what can we do to receive forgiveness?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Can we condone doing evil?
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: No, José, of course not.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Our laws and decrees are the things that set the norms of our society. They are what punishes our wrongdoings and leads us down a path of virtue. In our Code of Law, wrongdoings are never tolerated.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: The law disciplines. It has power, and it will punish those who have truly sinned.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: It may lead us down a path of virtue, but it doesn't always do so with punishment.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: What else, then?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: My dad always says a big stick and a broom does the trick.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The books say... repentance. We need to repent first, then acknowledge our mistakes, and then become a better person...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Exactly, my children.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You know what you've done is wrong. You understand friendship, and you think for others. That is a good thing.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: However... 'Whensoever you point out a mistake, you must first set an example.'
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Antonio, you must first ask yourself this question.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Ask yourself what had gone wrong in the string of events that led us to commit this crime?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Antonio, why did you steal?
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Because... I'm not as strong as the adults. No one wants to hire me, so I couldn't put together enough money.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: No! Antonio was trying to help me... It's all because I'm so useless...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I already told you! I'm the one who's wrong! S-Stop crying!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I understand now, Father. If I were just a little stronger, if I could find work sooner, I would have money, and I wouldn't have to do that.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Me too... I could've worked if I were tougher, and I wouldn't have dragged anyone into my mess.
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: I am glad to see both of you have already found where the problem lies.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Our bodies are fragile, and so even though our intentions are sincere, we sometimes turn to the wrong solutions to accomplish our goals. Many of our brothers and sisters make that mistake, and it's very regrettable.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: However—We can triumph over these predicaments. This place where we stand is shining so very radiantly because our forebears spread the scriptures of Laterano all across the land.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Its teachings will help us overcome the darkness that the disaster a hundred years ago brought down on us, and it will help us triumph over poverty and weakness.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: My hope is for our followers not to think our teachings a restraint, but to be able to see its most refined form.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: This is too hard to understand... Father, what should we do?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Just keep your faith, and you are doing very well.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: We unite, we strive to be benevolent, and we do good all because these teachings have cleansed our souls. They let us clearly see the benevolence inherent in our hearts.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: This is what I want to tell you—
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: You must believe. You must believe there is strength in your hearts.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Be pious, be friendly, and love others. 'Assist those who need assistance, and treat them well as you would your own hands and feet.' Antonio, you committed a crime to help José. José, you lied to protect your friend.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: It's wrong to steal or lie, but both of you have admitted your mistakes. This small misstep can be corrected in no time.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: I won't chastise you for your mistakes. On the contrary, I must tell you. We must treat each other like brothers. We must let our friendship drive our actions. As individuals, we are perhaps small and insignificant, but our friendship and unity empower us to become something greater.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: As long as we follow the teachings of the Code of Law and uncover its encouragement and calls for us to be benevolent, we'll find ourselves ever closer to each other, just like close siblings.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: This is how we'll awaken our souls and the benevolence and power within...
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: And with this, we'll find ourselves able to overcome every challenge we may face.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Uhh, I'm not sure I understand, Father.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I don't understand either...
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Father, this sounds really hard.
attributes.name: José

attributes.content: Don't be afraid of hardship or difficulty.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: It's okay. Even if you do not understand right now, what's inside your heart isn't going to fall apart.
attributes.name: Priest

attributes.content: Reverend Bishop! You are here! The stage is set, and everyone is waiting to hear your sermon!
attributes.name: Female Villager

attributes.content: W-What's going on? Did these two brats do anything to offend you?
attributes.name: Female Villager

attributes.content: No, no. They are very good boys.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: Come, we mustn't keep the others waiting. Antonio, please lead the way.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: R-Right!
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: And José... Come, come with me.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: We'll stand in the plaza and recognize our mistakes before everyone there. We'll make ourselves stronger, kinder, and more glorious.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: No matter what you do in the future, you must first understand how you truly feel. Question your heart as to how you think, whether your impulses truly come from your heart.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: The power that will make Iberia a better place and make us better men is right here, deep in our hearts.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: Remember, children.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop

attributes.content: You need only believe in yourselves.
attributes.name: Iberian Bishop
